article_headline: Conservative state senator says politicians don’t care whaVs best
article_text: TEL AVIV, Israel AP - U.S. envoy Philip C. Habib consulted Thursday with the leaders of Syria and Israel, but his diplomatic attempt to resolve the two countries’ dispute in Lebanon appeared threatened by the Syrian downing of a pilotless Israeli reconnaissance plane. The plane, called p ‘‘drone’’ and used to photograph troops on the ground, was shot down by a volley of Soviet-made SAM-6 missiles in eastern Lebanon while Habib was in Damascus 'Thursday morning for talks with Syrian President Hafez Assad. . Israel demands the Syrian missiles be removed from Lebanon. On ‘Thursday, Begin said the downing of the aircraft had created a “grave situation" even if Israeli pilots were not involved.
